titleStmt.title: A song upon the randizvous [sic] on Hounsley-Heath with a paralel of the destruction of our English Turks in the west, and the Mahomitans in Hungary : how the Christian Army, compos'd of forty thousand men, took New-Hassel, relieved Grand, defeated the Turks Army of sixty thousand men in two days time : to the tune Hark, hark the thundring cannons roar, &c.

A song upon the randizvous [sic] on Hounsley-Heath with a paralel of the destruction of our English Turks in the west, and the Mahomitans in Hungary : how the Christian Army, compos'd of forty thousand men, took New-Hassel, relieved Grand, defeated the Turks Army of sixty thousand men in two days time : to the tune Hark, hark the thundring cannons roar, &c.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
